data_table.description: Survival File and Follow-up for Cardiovascular Events, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2 (all cohorts) through 2012. This dataset contains validated endpoints information and should be used in conjunction with the corresponding "Sequence of Events" file - in this case dataset vr_soe4srv_2012_a_0965s. This dataset includes follow-up time for the following events: CVD, CHD, CHF, Stroke and Stroke/TIA.

variable.name: IDTYPE
variable.comment: IDTYPE and ID taken together form a unique study participant identification number.

variable.name: stroke_type
variable.comment: Indicates the type of stroke that the participant had. The coding corresponds to the "event" code from the SOE file.
variable.value: Definite CVA at exam 1, but questionable type

variable.name: stroketia_type
variable.comment: Indicates the type of stroke or TIA that the participant had. The coding corresponds to the "event" code from the SOE file. If a person had both stroke and TIA on the same day, stroke is counted as the first event and presented.
variable.value: Definite CVA at exam 1, but questionable type
TIA (Transient Ischemic Attack) only the 1st TIA is coded

variable.name: CHDDATE
variable.description: Date of Coronary Heart Disease (CHD) status
variable.comment: Date includes month, day and year, however, coding manual displays only month and year to preserve confidentiality. This date corresponds to the date the participant had CHD or the date of censoring (last known date the participant did not have CHD). Please refer to the protocol for explanation as to how the censoring date was calculated.

variable.name: CHFDATE
variable.description: Date of Congestive Heart Failure (CHF) status
variable.comment: Date includes month, day and year, however, coding manual displays only month and year to preserve confidentiality. This date corresponds to the date the participant had CHF or the date of censoring (last known date the participant did not have CHF). Please refer to the protocol for explanation as to how the censoring date was calculated.

variable.name: CVDDATE
variable.comment: Date includes month, day and year, however, coding manual displays only month and year to preserve confidentiality. This date corresponds to the date the participant had CVD or the date of censoring (last known date the participant did not have CVD). Please refer to the protocol for explanation as to how the censoring date was calculated.

variable.name: STROKE_TIADATE
variable.comment: Date includes month, day and year, however, coding manual displays only month and year to preserve confidentiality. This date corresponds to the date the participant had Stroke/TIA or the date of censoring (last known date the participant did not have Stroke/TIA). Please refer to the protocol for further explanation of how the censoring date was calculated.

variable.name: STROKEDATE
variable.comment: Date includes month, day and year, however, coding manual displays only month and year to preserve confidentiality. This date corresponds to the date the participant had Stroke or the date of censoring (last known date the participant did not have stroke). Please refer to the protocol for further explanation of how the censoring date was calculated.
